title: OnePlus 13 goes on sale in India: Check price, introductory offers, more - Business Standard
summary:
OnePlus 13 Now Available in India: Prices and Introductory Offers

Publication Date: January 7, 2023 | Source: Business Standard

The OnePlus 13 has been launched in India, featuring advanced specifications and attractive introductory offers for prospective buyers.

  • The smartphone is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon 8 Elite chip.
  • Features a camera system co-created with Hasselblad.
  • Available storage options: 12GB RAM + 256GB, 16GB RAM + 512GB, and 24GB RAM + 1TB.
  • Introductory offers include discounts for ICICI Bank card transactions and exchange bonuses for existing OnePlus users.
  • OnePlus is providing a 180-day replacement plan for early buyers.
“The OnePlus 13 flagship smartphone is powered by the Qualcomm Snapdragon eight Elite processor, with configurations offering up to 24GB of RAM and 1TB of storage.”

In conclusion, the OnePlus 13 presents premium features and offers, aiming to attract both new and existing customers.
newTitle: OnePlus 13 Now Available in India: Prices and Introductory Offers

summary:
Stock Market Live: Nifty, Sensex Flat As Surge In IT Stocks Offset Decline In Financials, Pharma, Energy

Date: July 4, 2023 | Source: NDTV

Both the Nifty 50 and Sensex showed resilience, recovering from earlier losses due to a rise in IT stocks compensating for declines in financial, pharmaceutical, and energy sectors.

  • Indian equities showed choppy trade, with swings between losses and gains.
  • Intraday, both Nifty and Sensex declined by approximately 0.7%.
  • Nifty was up 0.07% or 15 points at 23,540.
  • Sensex increased by 0.16% or 125 points to 77,750.
  • Broader indices such as Nifty Midcap 150 and Nifty Smallcap 250 were down 1% and 1.4%, respectively.
  • Nifty IT sector was a standout performer, up 3.75%, while Nifty Bank fell by 0.77%.
“There are no big expectations this earnings season, and downgrades are more likely.” - Andrew Holland, CEO of Avendus Alternate Strategies

Today’s market performance highlights the ongoing volatility, with significant movements in various sectors impacting overall equity trading. Stakeholders are keenly watching for potential catalysts as earnings downgrades loom on the horizon.
newTitle: Stock Market Update: Nifty and Sensex Steady Despite Losses in Other Sectors

title: HMPV cases rise in India: After infants, 80 year old man tests positive for HMPV, here are his symptoms - The Times of India
summary:
HMPV Cases Rise in India: New Infections Detected in Infants and an 80-Year-Old Man

Publication Date: Recent | Source: Times of India

The article discusses the rise in cases of human metapneumovirus (hMPV) in India, particularly noting a recent infection in an elderly man and previously reported cases in infants.

  • First identified cases took place in Bengaluru with two infants infected.
  • An 80-year-old man from Ahmedabad has also tested positive, exhibiting asthma symptoms.
  • The current condition of the elderly patient is stable, with no travel history.
  • hMPV predominantly impacts older adults and infants, with symptoms ranging from mild to severe respiratory issues.
  • Recommendations for hygiene and prevention are crucial to avoid the spread of hMPV.
“In older people the symptoms range from mild to severe... Young infants may exhibit irritability, poor feeding, and lethargy.”

In conclusion, the rise in hMPV cases underlines the importance of hygiene and preventive measures to protect vulnerable populations such as infants and the elderly.
newTitle: HMPV Cases Rise in India: New Infections Detected in Infants and an 80-Year-Old Man

title: Cluster of new mpox variant found in China: Know what it is - India Today
summary:
Cluster of New Mpox Variant Found in China: Know What It Is

Publication Date: Jan 10, 2025 | Source: India Today

Chinese health officials have identified a new mutated strain of mpox, known as clade Ib, in a foreigner who had traveled to the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC). This finding comes as mpox continues to spread globally, prompting concern from health authorities.

  • A cluster of cases was linked to an individual from the DRC, with four additional cases reported among close contacts.
  • Symptoms among infected individuals are reported to be mild, including skin rashes and blisters.
  • Mpox transmits through close contact and can lead to serious health issues in vulnerable populations.
  • Infection rates and deaths in the DRC raise alarms, particularly concerning individuals with underlying health conditions.
  • WHO's designation of mpox as a global public health emergency highlights the need for monitoring and containment measures.
"Clade Ib seems to be different, and is spreading largely through contact between humans, including through sex. Around 18,000 suspected cases of mpox, many of them among children, and at least 600 deaths potentially attributable to the disease have been reported this year (2024) in the DRC alone."

The mpox situation underscores the importance of public awareness and health measures to control the spread of this viral disease.
newTitle: Cluster of New Mpox Variant Identified in China

title: '1.27 million light-years long': Astronomers spot a new ultra-diffuse galaxy forming in Leo constellation;... - Moneycontrol
DailyObjects launches new Qi2-certified LOOP power banks: Price and details - Business Standard
summary:
DailyObjects Launches Qi2-Certified LOOP Power Banks

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: DailyObjects

India-based accessory brand DailyObjects has launched its LOOP series of power banks, which are claimed to be the first Qi2-certified power banks in the country.

The LOOP series is designed to support 15W fast wireless charging and is compatible with multiple smartphones and accessories following the Qi2 wireless charging standard. Below are the details regarding the pricing and availability:

  • 5000mAh: Rs 3,999
  • 10,000mAh: Rs 5,999
  • 20,000mAh: Rs 7,499

The LOOP power banks will be available on the DailyObjects website and will soon be listed on major e-commerce platforms like Amazon and Flipkart.

Key Features of the LOOP Power Banks

  • Qi2 certification ensuring compatibility with a range of smartphones including iPhones from the 12 series and select Android devices.
  • Aerospace-grade aluminium chassis with a distinctive loop pattern.
  • Built-in Apple Watch wireless charging modules in the 10,000mAh and 20,000mAh variants.
  • Retractable stand for convenience.

Understanding Qi2

Qi2 is an open wireless charging standard that enhances charging efficiency and safety through magnetic alignment.

“Qi2 provides faster and more efficient wireless charging.”

The launch of the LOOP power banks demonstrates DailyObjects' commitment to innovation in wireless charging solutions.
newTitle: DailyObjects Launches Qi2-Certified LOOP Power Banks

title: Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones - The Indian Express
summary:
Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

Publication Date: January 10, 2025

Source: Indian Express

This year's Maha Kumbh Mela in Prayagraj marks a significant technological advancement with the introduction of the Digi Kumbh initiative, aiming to enhance security and management through AI and digital tools.

  • The event is expected to attract around 40 crore pilgrims.
  • Over 2,750 CCTV cameras will ensure comprehensive surveillance.
  • AI technology is being utilized to track crowd movements effectively.
  • This initiative is considered the largest face recognition exercise in India.
“I have been playing bhajans (hymns) and taking photos on my phone. Since there is no Internet, I cannot use any of the Kumbh apps,” said Vijaypuri Bapu, a naga sadhu.

The digital transformation at Maha Kumbh Mela represents a blend of tradition and technology, aiming for a safer and more organized gathering for millions.
newTitle: Maha Kumbh goes digital: 2,700 CCTVs, AI to track crowd, underwater drones

summary:
From Shanaya Kapoor, Aryan Khan to Rasha Thadani: 7 Star Kids Making Their Bollywood Debut in 2025

Date: Jan 10, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

2025 has arrived with a fresh wave of star kids eager to debut in the Hindi film industry. This article explores seven star kids ready to take the leap and examines their backgrounds, debuts, and the films they're associated with this year.

  • Shanaya Kapoor: Set to debut in Aankhon Ki Gustaakhiyan.
  • Ibrahim Ali Khan: Making his debut in Sarzameen.
  • Ahaan Panday: Starring in a young love story directed by Mohit Suri.
  • Rasha Thadani: Debuting in Azaad, releasing on January 17.
  • Aaman Devgan: Also debuting in Azaad.
  • Simar Bhatia: Set to appear in Ikkis.
  • Aryan Khan: Making his debut as a writer and director with the Netflix series Stardom.
“After surfing through the batch of 2025, who do you have the highest expectations from this year?”

This year is poised for exciting new entries in Bollywood, as these star kids step into the limelight, each with their unique backgrounds and flair.
newTitle: Star Kids Making Their Bollywood Debut in 2025

"Gautam Gambhir Abused My Family, Said Bad Things About Sourav Ganguly": Manoj Tiwary - NDTV Sports
summary:
Gautam Gambhir Abused My Family, Said Bad Things About Sourav Ganguly: Manoj Tiwary

Publication Date: January 25, 2025 | Source: NDTV Sports

Former cricketer Manoj Tiwary has strongly criticized Gautam Gambhir, the current head coach of the Indian cricket team, for his management and selection decisions during the recent series against Australia and New Zealand.

  • Tiwary labels Gambhir a 'hypocrite' for not practicing what he preaches.
  • He highlights biases in player selections and questions the dropping of Akash Deep.
  • Tiwary recalls past incidents where Gambhir allegedly abused his family and criticized Sourav Ganguly.
  • Criticism of player inclusions like Devdutt Padikkal over more deserving players like Abhimanyu Easwaran.
“When he fought with me during the Ranji Trophy match in Delhi, everyone heard every word from Gautam Gambhir's mouth.” - Manoj Tiwary

The ongoing criticism from former players highlights concerns about Gambhir's coaching and the direction of Indian cricket. Tiwary's comments raise questions about the management of player selections and the culture within the team.
newTitle: Manoj Tiwary Criticizes Gautam Gambhir's Coaching and Team Selection
